question: 早々
sourceAnswer:
<read>そうそう</read>:: as-soon-as.../just-after.../immediately-after... | hurriedly/in-haste/quickly/promptly/early
<read>はやばや</read>:: early/quickly/promptly
sourceMnemonic: Essentially you have the kanji <kanji><ja>早</ja></kanji> twice, because <ja>々</ja> is just a repeater kanji. When you have something <kanji>early</kanji> twice, it obviously has some kind of urgency to it. You'll need to take an action <vocabulary>as soon as</vocabulary> you finish whatever it is you're doing there.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is just the on'yomi readings (which you learned with the kanji) twice in a row.
